sentences.en: ... the unit headed by Sergeant Bell.
sentences.cn: 由贝尔巡佐带领的分队。

sentences.en: A little later the church bell clanged.
sentences.cn: 过了一小会儿，教堂的钟当当敲响了。

sentences.en: An old-fashioned bell tinkled as he pushed open the door.
sentences.cn: 当他推开门时，一口旧式的钟丁零零地响了起来。

sentences.en: everybody's waiting for you with bells on.
sentences.cn: 大家都在热情地等着你。

sentences.en: He bounded up the steps and pushed the bell of the door.
sentences.cn: 他跳着上了台阶，按下了门铃。

sentences.en: I was going to give you a bell tomorrow.
It frequently appears that Bell mistrusts all journalists.
sentences.cn: 似乎贝尔常常对所有新闻记者都持怀疑态度。

sentences.en: It gave a metallic clang, like a cracked bell.
sentences.cn: 它发出了金属碰击般的哐啷声，跟破钟似的。

sentences.en: Mary heard the penetrating bell of an ambulance.
sentences.cn: 玛丽听到了刺耳的救护车警铃声。

sentences.en: Miss Peel tinkled her desk bell and they all sat down again.
sentences.cn: 皮尔小姐摇了摇她桌子上的铃铛，他们全都又坐下了。

sentences.en: Police have charged Mr Bell with murder.
sentences.cn: 警方已经起诉贝尔先生犯有谋杀罪。

sentences.en: She huddled inside the porch as she rang the bell.
sentences.cn: 她按门铃时身子在门廊里缩成一团。

sentences.en: The bell went and everyone rushed out of the classroom.
sentences.cn: 铃声一响，大家都冲出了教室。

sentences.en: The door was opened before she could ring the bell.
sentences.cn: 她还没来得及按门铃，门就开了。

sentences.en: They skip rope and play catch, waiting for the bell.
sentences.cn: 他们又是跳绳，又是玩接球，等着上课铃声响起。

sentences.en: They stood together on the stoop and rang the bell.
sentences.cn: 他们一起站在门廊上按响了门铃。

sentences.en: When the bell rings, more than 1,000 children spill from classrooms.
sentences.cn: 当铃声响起时，1,000多名孩子从教室里涌了出来。

words.tran_cn: 隆起；爬行（belly的过去分词形式）

phrases.tran_cn: n. 亚历山大·格雷厄姆·贝尔（电话发明者）
被铃声解救（拳击或其他体育项目中因铃声宣布一个回合结束而幸免未被判输）
(非正式)附加的诱人特色（或点缀）
n. [美]独立钟（指美国费城独立厅的大钟，1776年7月4日鸣此钟宣布美国独立，1835年被损）
(非正式)唤起遥远的回忆；听上去熟悉

trans.tran_en: a piece of electrical equipment that makes a ringing sound, used as a signal or to get someone’s attention
